intro: Magnolia sieboldii subsp. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to Japan. It is characterized by its large, showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring before the leaves emerge. The plant has broad, ovate leaves that are glossy on top and hairy underneath. It typically grows to a height of 8–15 meters and prefers well-drained, acidic soils. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
